meanings.definition: Select as an object of attention or attack.
meanings.sent1: The detective targeted the suspect for questioning.
meanings.sent2: The marketing campaign targeted young adults interested in fitness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat targeted the shiny ornaments on the Christmas tree.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit targeted the flaws in his argument.
meanings.sent5: The sniper carefully targeted the enemy soldier in the distance.

meanings.definition: Aim or direct at a particular goal or objective.
meanings.sent1: The archer targeted the bullseye with precision.
meanings.sent2: She targeted her savings for a vacation to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The chef targeted the perfect balance of flavors in her dish.
meanings.sent4: His speech targeted the hearts of the audience, inspiring them to action.
meanings.sent5: The student targeted a top score on the exam and studied diligently.
